Quality.definition: A feature or characteristic of something.

Beauty.definition: The quality of being pleasing to the senses.

Clarity.definition: The quality of being clear and easy to understand.

Color.definition: The property possessed by an object of producing different sensations on the eye as a result of the way the object reflects or emits light.

Complexity.definition: The state or quality of being intricate or complicated.

Consistency.definition: The quality of achieving a level of performance which does not vary greatly in quality over time.

Depth.definition: The distance from the top or surface of something to its bottom.

Diversity.definition: The state of being diverse; variety.

Hardness.definition: The quality or condition of being hard.

Height.definition: The measurement from base to top or (of a standing person) from head to foot.

Importance.definition: The state or fact of being of great significance or value.

Length.definition: The measurement or extent of something from end to end.

Shape.definition: The external form or appearance characteristic of someone or something; the outline of an area or figure.

Simplicity.definition: The quality or condition of being easy to understand or do.

Size.definition: The relative extent of something; a thing's overall dimensions or magnitude.

Softness.definition: The quality of being easy to press, bend, cut, or fold.

Speed.definition: The rate at which someone or something is able to move or operate.

Temperature.definition: The degree of heat present in a substance or object.

Texture.definition: The feel, appearance, or consistency of a surface or a substance.

Weight.definition: The heaviness of a person or thing.

Width.definition: The measurement or extent of something from side to side.
